title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer will practice at second and third bases during Red Sox spring training in Fort Myers.
Manager Alex Cora aims to finalize Red Sox's infield positions soon, with options like Gonzalez, Sogard, and Kiner-Falefa.
Boston seeks to reduce infield errors after leading MLB in 2025, with a focus on improving defensive versatility.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant stays with New England, declines interviews for open offensive coordinator positions.
Drake Maye credits Ashton Grant for his developmental progress in a successful second season with Patriots.
Ashton Grant, a former Assumption University receiver, has coached under Mike Vrabel since February 2025.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Community raises over $25,000 for Matt's Barber Shop in Brighton after severe flooding from a burst pipe.
Customer Dietrich Warner initiated a GoFundMe to support the shop, quickly surpassing $25,800 in donations.
Benefit show planned for Feb. 19 at O’Brien’s Pub to further aid the barbershop's recovery efforts.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Romcom 'Eternity' featuring Elizabeth Olsen, Miles Teller, and Callum Turner now streaming on Apple TV.
'When Harry Met Sally' and classic 'Harold and Maude' are available on Hulu and Pluto TV respectively.
Season 10 of 'Love Is Blind' airs on Netflix; 'Dawson's Creek' streaming on Netflix, Hulu, and Tubi.

title: Court says Mass. father’s battle over LGBTQ-friendly lessons excludes books on gender stereotypes
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge ruled that a Lexington father's lawsuit excludes two books focusing on gender stereotypes, not gender identity.
The father, referred to as Alan L., challenged LGBTQ+ themed lessons but must identify classroom materials against his family's values.
Judge Saylor determined the disputed books address gender stereotypes, allowing their use without opt-out provisions for Alan L.'s son.

title: Roman Anthony set to join Team USA for World Baseball Classic if he passes physical
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony of the Boston Red Sox is set to join Team USA for the World Baseball Classic pending a physical.
Anthony, 21, would be the youngest player on the team, replacing injured Diamondback outfielder Corbin Carroll.
Anthony had a .292 average and .859 OPS in 71 MLB games; he hasn't had a physical since a 2025 oblique injury.

title: $20M penthouse at Taylor Swift’s rumored wedding venue hits market
author: Regina Cole
bullets: The Ocean House penthouse in Westerly, Rhode Island is for sale at $20 million, located at 1 Bluff Avenue #4-1.
The 4,696-square-foot penthouse includes three bedrooms, four bathrooms, and extensive amenities like a private beach and gym access.
Rumors suggest Taylor Swift may marry at the Ocean House, adding potential prestige to the property's already luxurious appeal.

title: 10 Celtics stats that should show encouragement and discouragement entering All-Star break
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics are 35-19, ranked second in Eastern Conference, with top three offensive and defensive ratings.
Jaylen Brown leads team with 29.3 points per game, achieving first All-Star starter selection this season.
Celtics struggle in clutch games, ranked 21st with a 12-14 record, the worst among playoff teams.

title: Your Cape Cod winter guide: 20 things to do during the cold months
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Cape Cod offers winter activities including museums, beaches, and trails across its 15 towns for visitors.
Top spots include Sandwich Glass Museum, JFK Hyannis Museum, Cape Cod Museum of Art, and Wydah Pirate Museum.
Dining and drinks highlights include Bamboo Chinese Cuisine, Leonessa in Yarmouth Port, and Devil’s Purse Brewing Company.

title: She’s running Boston for people like her with Type 1 Diabetes
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Kristine Lapczynski, from Fuquay-Varina, NC, will run the 2026 Boston Marathon to support Type 1 Diabetes research.
Lapczynski, who has lived with Type 1 Diabetes for 23 years, was inspired by her own hospitalization and family experiences.
She is running for Breakthrough T1D, highlighting the personal impact of the disease on her life and her family's health.
